pageTitle: Only three weeks left to design a new bus for London

title.title: Only three weeks left to design a new bus for London

texts: Budding bus designers have just three weeks left to submit designs for a new bus for London. The competition to design a bus inspired by the classic Routemaster was one of the Mayor's key manifesto pledges.
I am sure that there are still many people out there with cracking ideas for our new bus
The Mayor of London, Boris Johnson, said: 'There has been a lot of interest in the competition but I am sure that there are still many people out there with cracking ideas for our new bus.
'There are just three weeks to go and I hope even more people - be they professional designers, bus passengers, drivers or even kids on their holidays - take the time to submit their ideas.'
Transport Commissioner Peter Hendy said: 'We're looking for a modern, accessible, environmentally friendly design that will be an asset to London.
'We have a history of innovation in public transport and design, and we will marry our expertise with the best ideas from the competition to produce a brand new icon for London.'
Entrants are encouraged to submit their designs in one of two categories:

The judges will be looking for the best ideas rather than detailed technical designs","Designers have until Friday 19 September to submit their entries. As well as potentially seeing their design on the streets of London, the best designer could pocket a first prize of £25,000"]}
Further details and full terms and conditions of the competition can be found on the TfL website at tfl.gov.uk/anewbusforlondon
The Mayor will announce the winning designs at the end of October.
